By Eagle Fierce on Wednesday, April 25, 2001 - 09:03 am:

I guess I'll give it a try! (This is not one of my important posts!)
greenspun.com : LUSENET : Monster Rancher 2 : One Thread

Since "Celious" has been absent of projects the last few days, I've decided to take his place (temporarily). Note that I am NOT trying to dethrone him. I don't work the best with prides, anyway! (I prefer the illusive vulpis Canus, myself.) Enough of my babbling....ON WITH THE SHOW!
If you could create yourself in a digital image (make yourself a video game character), what would you look like, and what would your attributes contain?

-- Eagle Dewell Fierce (Eagle1@Citynet.net), February 13, 2000
Answers
Eagle?! HOW DARE YOU! TRYING TO TAKE MY PLACE?! I THOUGHT WE WERE PRETTY GOOD FRIENDS! Joking. I haven't made any because I have run out of ideas. Hope I didn't offend you or something.
I would be a... (Everyone on the board: Great. We KNOW what's coming. Oh well.) a were-lion. My attributes would be Holy and Fire type attacks. Only always in the were-lion state. No human state for me! Can anyone say "anthromorph"? Good for you. I would be a great fighter....ripping through flesh with razor-sharp claws... striking terror in the hearts of my enemies....OOOOHHH....*Shiver*....Coolness man! Laters!

-- Celious (lionmage@hotmail.com), February 13, 2000.

Don't worry Celious! The only way that one can offend me is to offend someone else. I hope that I haven't offended you in borrowing your idea of a creative session (They get addictive so quickly!). Now, on with my description.
I, too, would be an anthropomorphic. I would be a six foot, four inch (my actual height). I would have velvety soft wings, that are as pure as the stars in a midnight sky. These seem to emmanate from my back, and would stretch three meters into the sky, glancing at a 45 degree angle. My golden body is shrouded with a teal colored wind breaker, adorned with silver angular patterns, and opening up to reveal a basic white T-shirt. My arms are a genetc nightmare. The left arm is a dangerous talon, exposing the raptor-like spikes that appear to be fingernails. The upper-right appendage (right arm) is a twisted culmination of an inter-species marriage. It has four tips on the talon (not counting the apposable thumb), instead of three, and has a fine layer of rusty fur protruding from the surface, with a small, almost leathery pad found on the palm. The fur continues to spread to the lower hindquarters, and thus, is tarped with a pair a regular fit blue jeans. The feet do not suffer from the problem with my arms, and are a fine set of landing talons. These beauties can grapple onto anything, and make excellent weapons! Still, I prefer the use of swords, if in combat. Although, my feet are free from the deformities, my tail is not so lucky. Unlike a normal Eagle, my tail is not a crest of triangular shaped feathers. Rather, it is a tarnished wave of fur, measuring half of my height in length. It is tipped with a cream tuft, making it all the more noticable. Finally, there's my head. It is the one of the most unusual occurences one may find in nature. Imagine a the head of a bald eagle with the pointed ears of a some sort of brown Canid, and razor-like incisors located in a, longer than average, beak. My eyes are emerald, but contain flecks that tint the amber, providing you look closely enough. You now have a face to go with the name. Maybe someday, the rest of you will find your true identity.
Note: This project is in actuallity a psychological test. It forces you to project yourself into an illustration that shows how you truely see things. Sorry for the trickery. Still, I think that it's a very intersting scenario. Opinions?

-- Eagle Fierce (Eagle1@Citynet.net), February 13, 2000.

Well THAT was descriptive. I wonder if I can describe myself that well. I haven't really tried to see what I would actually look like.
I stand about 6'7". My body is muscular and toned. My fur is a gold- brown. My mane stops at my shoulders on the side, on the back it stops between my shoulder blades and is in a ponytail. A scar is over my right eye. I have claw scars on the left side of my chest, a trophy to my battles. On the left of my chest is a tatoo on the shape of a lion's claw and it has a cross behind it. I wear a pair of white pants, held in place by a white belt. The tuft on the tip of my tail is actually a small flame, with white mixed in with the red of the flames. My fangs are razor sharp. On the top each arm is fur that is more golden in color than the rest of the fur surrounding it. It begins right above the wrist and ends before the elbow. It is also about an inch longer than the surrounding fur. My eyes are brown with a golden tint. They have a look about them that suggests wisdom as well as power and honor. My paws have razor sharp claws at the end of each digit. On my right ear is a silver earring in the shape of a cross. I have a samurai sword strapped to my side, with an uncut emerald in the grip. The emerald glows from within with a white light. Emblazoned on the sword's blade is an enscription in gold:
"To uphold what is just, to protect what is pure."

-- Celious (lionmage@hotmail.com), February 13, 2000.

-- stupid (twopacliveson@hotmail.com), February 13, 2000.

Not bad, Celious! The problem that I see in your description is the objective correlative. Basically, you are telling an action, rather than showing it.
Ex. My mane stops at my shoulders on the side, on the back it stops between my shoulder blades and is in a ponytail.
To make this more descriptive, you could have said....
The sides of my mane seem to flow to my shoulders, whereas the back cascades to from a ponytail that lies between my shoulder blades.
I appologize if I hurt your feelings in this response. Your writing isn't bad at all, but your descriptiveness of your writing could use a little work. As for trying to be AS descriptive as I....don't worry about it. Many english professors claim that I have a natural talent for the work (I'm not trying to sound cocky). If this is true than it is completely understandable.

-- Eagle Fierce (Eagle1@Citynet.net), February 13, 2000.

/_\ (I take my writing seriously. A little too seriously. Just ignore this. Just showing how I feel and I know I have issues.)

-- Celious (lionmage@hotmail.com), February 13, 2000.

I would think that you would want to hear the truth, and isn't it better to hear the truth from someone that you can trust? I am sure that a little practice is all that it takes. I mean, do you ACTUALLY think that I didn't have to learn about this?!?

Creating Session 10: You are a leader in the IMA....
greenspun.com : LUSENET : Monster Rancher 2 : One Thread

You are the Director of Events in the IMA. You have just recieved a missive (note) from the president of IMA. It reads:
Dear Director of Events,
The committee of the island has just announced that they will approve the making of a new holiday to recognise all monster trainers and to honor their hard work. You must come up with ideas for this new day. We will be waiting for your report.
Ivan Flak, President
You must come up with a new holiday to honor all trainers. Plan out the day and what events will take place. Examples are:
Battles
Special Events
Contests
Seminars on Monster Raising Tips and Secrets
And of course, music!
Now try your hand and see what you can come up with! Looking forward to it! Laters!

-- Celious (lionmage@hotmail.com), February 13, 2000
Answers

To Jiggypuff:
I say, I, I, I say, make sure that it's Kentucky fried, boy! I say, the boy has the right idea, but something just aint right in the head. (Foghorn Leghorn impression)
To everyone else:
I think that the celebration should be like a carnival, or something to that effect. First of all, there should be divisions for battling (if not an S class could walk in and CRUSH an E class monster, and I'm strictly for fairness in combat.). Next, the trainers will have to battle in accordance to honor. The trainers will adorn themselves with lightweight Metalner armor and shields, so that nobody is truely hurt in the conflict. The reason behind this, is because no monster will respect a trainer that wouldn't go through the same acts that are requested of it. They schedule might resemble this:

10:00AM - E class competition (minimal requirement of 100L 50P 50I 75S 25Sp 50D)(maximum limit of 300L 400P 400I 250Sp 300D)

10:30AM - Trainer's lessons in beginners combat, taught by Coltia.

11:00AM - Intermediate lessons in combat against intelligent techniques, instructed by Holly and Poritoka (optional).

11:00AM - Trainer's E class Tourney - Items to boost intelligence or power may be used, but no blunt objects are allowed in the ring.

11:00AM - Intermediate lessons in combat against power techniques, taught by Tesca (optional).

11:30AM - Advanced techniques in maxed-out combat, instructed by Pabs, Head Master of the IMA (S class trainers only!).

12:00PM - Trainer's D&C class Tourney - Weapons may be used, but must be inspected to ensure that it may cause no serious injury.

12:30AM - D class Competition - (minimal requirement of 200L 150P 150I 125S 150Sp 100D) (maximal requirement of 500L 500P 500I 300S 300Sp 400D)
I have a class, now, so I will continue this list later.

-- Eagle Fierce (Eagle1@Citynet.net), February 14, 2000.

-- Celious (lionmage@hotmail.com), February 14, 2000.

Okay. Time for my two cents. Actually, it's more like $13.50
My carnival is a week long.
Day 1

9:00-9:15 A.M.- Speech by Ivan Flak of IMA to all trainers

9:15-10:00 A.M.- All E class monsters competing must go through a physical exam and pass to compete.

10:00-11:00- All monsters outfitted with light protective armor. Trainers also must wear armor, since they will be on the fighting field as well.

10:00-12:00- E class battles: Round Robin Style

12:00-6:00- Festivities and Seminars on Monster Raising Tips and Secrets. Seminar led by Pabs.

6:00-7:00- Awards given to 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place monsters and trainers.

7:00-7:30- Closing speech by Ivan Flak.

-- Celious (lionmage@hotmail.com), February 14, 2000.

The Festival Schedule Continued

any time during the festival - Arm wrestle/Sumo with a Beclon, Golem, Dragon, Jill and/or Henger. Prize for winning is a "Courage Badge"

*"Courage Badge" - A medalion with the words "It takes great courage to stand up to those that are stronger, and even more courage to accomplish the task." (It makes your monster more willful during tournaments).*

any time during the festival - Pixie's Shoot'em Up Gallery - Aim Pixie's arm at the target and squeeze to let her know that you want to shoot. If the "Bolt" hits the target, you win some "Fake Gold."

*"Fake Gold" - Once known as Iron Pirite, today people have decided to classify it as a more recognizable name (It is worth 100G).*

any time during the festival - The Big Boo House - Basically, a haunted house ride that is inhabited by the Ghost species (Don't worry, they're friendly...How can anyone be afraid of the Ghost species, anyways).

1:00PM - Dream Tech. Center- What celebration would be comlete without some kind of childish attraction. This is the place where intelligence based monsters (such as Pixie, Suezo, Ghost, etc.) use their psychic abilities to do simple parlor tricks (ie. the Suezo will read people's mind, the Ghost will perform magical card tricks, and the Pixie will make beautiful light shows.) There is also a place where one may sleep, and endulge in massive fantasies, courtesy of the Suezo technique, "Telepathy." (No the fantasies are not ALL dirty!).

1:30PM - Festival Feast - A picnic area where one may enjoy the countryside, and grab a a bite to eat. All of the foods, for humans, are prepared over an Phoenix's flame, and will consist of traditional picnic accessories (hot dogs, hamburgers, chicken sandwiches (just don't tell the Phoenix what they are), french fries, and many other cholesterol drenched foods (It's a party! Worry about the cholesterol later.). Monsters will be served a variety of meals, varying in accordence to its type. A plentiful amount of "Nuts Oil" will be served, as well.

3:00PM - Advanced classes in raising techniques, taught by the master of genetics....RNA (5th rank license or above required).

3:30PM - B&A class Tourney - (minimal requirement of 350L 400P 400I 300S 250Sp 300D) (maximal limit of 800L 999P 999I 500S 500Sp 999D)

4:00PM - Monster Techniques & Strategies - (Mainly for novices) Learn the abilities of your monster's species, and learn a few battle techniques, yourself. Hosted by Nate Railsback, the tech king.

4:30PM - Trainer's B&A Class Competition - The goal is to disarm your opponent, heavy armor will be worn, and will inevitably slow the trainers down. Any weapon may be used.

5:00PM - Undine's (Under)Water Palace - A place to relax and have fun after a long battle. The Undine Water Dancers are magnificent, and at nighttime, will put on some AQUAsome displays (pun on the word awesome) of what haitch two O (H2O) can do. There is also a mrine life show, so that the kids may learn something, as well as have fun. Needless to say, many will return here before the closing ceremonies.

5:30PM - S class Tourney - (minimum requirement of 500L 600P and/or 600I 450S 500S 400D) (maximal limit of 999 on more than two stats)

6:30PM - Trainer's S Class Competition - A truely dangerous competition! The trainers will be clad in only the lightweight of the Metalner armor, and will be priviledged to use any weapon. There will be five targets outlined on the trainers body. The objective is to remove the armor that these five targets cover. Medical technicians will be on stand-by.

7:00PM - MASTER's Competition - The closest thing that can come to bloodlust! Both trainers will be oufitted in glow-in-the-dark, heavyweight, Metalner armor, that will enhance ALL attributes. They will be allowed to use any weapon, and the opponent that is disarmed, as well as disarmored, is the victor. Special technicians will be on stand-by to ensure minimal injury.

8:00PM - MASTER Class Tourney - (minimal requirement of three maxed- out stats) (no maximal limit!) The monster must win by KO! Vets will be present to assist any that are injured,

9:00PM - Return to Undine's (Under)Water Palace - Return to this place for the REAL fireworks! Every technical pyrotechnic that you can think of will be put off in celebration of the "Monster Passion Week."

last night - 10:00PM - 12:00AM - The Closing Ceremonies - "As the long days of the festival come to a close, we realize the joy and burden of our faithful monsters. Through proper raising and commitment, these trainers and monsters have ALL become winners. Whether it be the agonizing humiliation of loss in combat, or the MASTER lessons that intrigue the mind, as well as the spirit, we have learned much from this week. I am very proud of each and every one of you, for having the ability to see what it means to be a TRUE rancher. And now, I will unveil the winner (based on the statisics (wins/losses) of the week."

E class Winner - "Trainer & Monster" - A book decribing where all of your monsters techniques are located, and the tech. chains.

D&C class Winner - "20,000G" - Self-evident.

B&A class Winner - "Hero or Heel Badge" - We all know what this does.

S class Winner - "Winner's Badge" - Increases a monsters determination to get higher statistics.
MASTER class Winner - "Badge of Valor" - An honorary medallion that is inscribed with the words "If trained properly, a monster can be anything that one can dream. I am the proof that the impossible is possible." This item increases all of the trainer's monster's characterisitcs by 25%.

-- Eagle Fierce (Eagle1@Citynet.net), February 14, 2000.

In reguard to your "Are you sure you're not a lion?" question:

Actually, I consider myself to be a Fierce:
(Eagle/Fox/Wolf/Griffin/Jackal) It is, just, that I contain more of the Eagle influence in me, than any other (It IS, afterall, my totem!).
49% = Eagle, 27% = Vulpine (Fox), 9.8% = Wolf, 7.2% = Gryphon, 3.81% Jackal, and I'm still looking for the other .??%.

Part of my personality may be linked with my middle name, Dewell. Unfortunately, I have no idea what this name translates into. I DO know that it is in some sort of Native American language. I also know that it was a proud name, for I was named after my great grandfather. He had two brothers....one was named Hoy Tecumseh (not sure about the spelling), and the other was named Roy Hiawatha (also not sure about the spelling). These were two VERY FAMOUS Native Americans, yet, there is no mention of the name "Dewell" in any text. I am guessing that this is some sort of totem, or emotion, or something, but I have no proof. I have been searching for years for this information! If anybody knows what this means, I'm BEGGING you to help me! (I don't usually ask for help, but this has been plaguing my conscience for years, now.)

-- Eagle Fierce (Eagle1@Citynet.net), February 14, 2000.

Actually, the "Are you sure you're not a lion?" question was hypothetical in nature. Cool festival Eagle!

-- Celious (lionmage@hotmail.com), February 14, 2000.

Creating Session 11: A Silly Suggestion
greenspun.com : LUSENET : Monster Rancher 2 : One Thread

Hey, this one is STUPID but unique. Companies have mascots.
Ex. Tony the Tiger
Betty Crocker
Capn Crunch
Aunt Jemima
Toucan Sam
What if you caould raise a mascot as a monster? What attacks would it have? Different sub-breeds? I think this could be one of the funny creating sessions. (I know it's stupid, but I try to make on average one a day.) Laters!

-- Celious (lionmage@hotmail.com), February 14, 2000
Answers
